summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between prosecutors from the New York County District Attorney's Office (Manhattan DA) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding the coordination of investigations into sexual abuse allegations against Leon Black. The emails discuss a new cooperating witness (CW) who alleges abuse by Black and was trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, and the need to deconflict investigations and share information.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: The billionaire financier who is the subject of sexual abuse allegations being investigated by both the Manhattan DA and SDNY.

persons.name: Jeanne Christensen
persons.context: Attorney representing a victim/client in the Leon Black investigation. Prosecutors seek her permission to share investigation details.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the individuals, along with Jeffrey Epstein, who trafficked the new cooperating witness who has accused Leon Black.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the individuals, along with Ghislaine Maxwell, who trafficked the new cooperating witness who has accused Leon Black.

connections.description: Connection implied through a new cooperating witness who alleges abuse by Black and states she was trafficked by Maxwell and Epstein.
Connection implied through a new cooperating witness who alleges abuse by Black and states she was trafficked by Epstein and Maxwell.
Christensen is identified as the attorney for a victim making allegations against Leon Black.
Described together as the traffickers of the new cooperating witness in the Leon Black case.

events.title: Coordination Call Scheduled
events.description: Prosecutors from the Manhattan DA's Office and SDNY schedule a phone call to discuss their respective investigations into Leon Black.

events.title: SDNY Updates Investigation Status
events.description: An SDNY prosecutor informs the Manhattan DA that they have no current plans to interview a specific victim and are unlikely to open a separate investigation, pending the DA's actions.

events.title: New Cooperating Witness Comes Forward
events.description: Manhattan DA prosecutors reach out to SDNY to report a new cooperating witness (CW) has alleged sexual abuse by Leon Black and that she was trafficked by Maxwell and Epstein.

events.title: Permission Granted to Share Information
events.description: An SDNY prosecutor confirms that attorney Jeanne Christensen has given permission to share details of their investigation with the Manhattan DA's Office.

keyFacts: A new cooperating witness (CW) alleged in 2023 that she was sexually abused by billionaire Leon Black and that she had been trafficked by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

The Manhattan District Attorney's Office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York were actively communicating to deconflict their separate investigations into sexual abuse allegations against Leon Black.
Attorney Jeanne Christensen represented at least one victim in the Leon Black investigation, and prosecutors sought her permission to share investigative details between offices.
The email chain reveals ongoing investigative activity into Leon Black related to the Epstein/Maxwell sex trafficking network, extending well past Epstein's death and Maxwell's trial.
